abstract.p: Danish scientific ethics panel overturns earlier criticism of Dr Bjorn Lomborg's book Skeptical Environments, which challenges many environmental theories, including effects of gas emissions linked to global warming; Ministry of Science cited panel's inability to show scientific dishonesty in Lomborg's theories (S)

block.p: A scientific ethics panel has withdrawn its criticism of the book ''Skeptical Environmentalist,'' an upbeat analysis of global trends that was embraced by conservatives and attacked by environmental scientists after it was published in English in 2001. The decision was prompted by a Ministry of Science rebuke that the panel presented no evidence supporting its conclusion that the author, Bjorn Lomborg, displayed ''scientific dishonesty.'' Dr. Lomborg, a statistician, challenges many goals of environmental groups, including curbing gases linked to global warming.
